00030 
00031 #ifndef UART_H_
00032 #define UART_H_
00033 
00034 
00035 /** 
00036  *  @defgroup pfleury_uart UART Library
00037  *  @code #include <uart.h> @endcode
00038  * 
00039  *  @brief Interrupt UART library using the built-in UART with transmit and receive circular buffers. 
00040  *
00041  *  This library can be used to transmit and receive data through the built in UART. 
00042  *
00043  *  An interrupt is generated when the UART has finished transmitting or
00044  *  receiving a byte. The interrupt handling routines use circular buffers
00045  *  for buffering received and transmitted data.
00046  *
00047  *  The UART_RX_BUFFER_SIZE and UART_TX_BUFFER_SIZE constants define
00048  *  the size of the circular buffers in bytes. Note that these constants must be a power of 2.
00049  *  You may need to adapt this constants to your target and your application by adding 
00050  *  CDEFS += -DUART_RX_BUFFER_SIZE=nn -DUART_RX_BUFFER_SIZE=nn to your Makefile.
00051  *
00052  *  @note Based on Atmel Application Note AVR306
00053  *  @author Peter Fleury pfleury@gmx.ch  http://jump.to/fleury
00054  */
00055  
00056 /**@{*/
00057 
00058 
00059 #if (__GNUC__ * 100 + __GNUC_MINOR__) < 304
00060 #error "This library requires AVR-GCC 3.4 or later, update to newer AVR-GCC compiler !"
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 
00064 /*
00065 ** constants and macros
00066 */
00067 
00068 /** @brief  UART Baudrate Expression
00069  *  @param xtalCpu  system clock in Mhz, e.g. 4000000L for 4Mhz          
00070  *  @param baudRate baudrate in bps, e.g. 1200, 2400, 9600     
00071  */
00072 #define UART_BAUD_SELECT(baudRate,xtalCpu) ((xtalCpu)/((baudRate)*16l)-1)
00073 
00074 /** @brief  UART Baudrate Expression for ATmega double speed mode
00075  *  @param  xtalCpu  system clock in Mhz, e.g. 4000000L for 4Mhz           
00076  *  @param  baudRate baudrate in bps, e.g. 1200, 2400, 9600     
00077  */
00078 #define UART_BAUD_SELECT_DOUBLE_SPEED(baudRate,xtalCpu) (((xtalCpu)/((baudRate)*8l)-1)|0x8000)
00079 
00080 
00081 /** Size of the circular receive buffer, must be power of 2 */
00082 #ifndef UART_RX_BUFFER_SIZE
00083 #define UART_RX_BUFFER_SIZE 32
00084 #endif
00085 /** Size of the circular transmit buffer, must be power of 2 */
00086 #ifndef UART_TX_BUFFER_SIZE
00087 #define UART_TX_BUFFER_SIZE 32
00088 #endif
00089 
00090 /* test if the size of the circular buffers fits into SRAM */
00091 #if ( (UART_RX_BUFFER_SIZE+UART_TX_BUFFER_SIZE) >= (RAMEND-0x60 ) )
00092 #error "size of UART_RX_BUFFER_SIZE + UART_TX_BUFFER_SIZE larger than size of SRAM"
00093 #endif
00094 
00095 /* 
00096 ** high byte error return code of uart_getc()
00097 */
00098 #define UART_FRAME_ERROR      0x0800              /* Framing Error by UART       */
00099 #define UART_OVERRUN_ERROR    0x0400              /* Overrun condition by UART   */
00100 #define UART_BUFFER_OVERFLOW  0x0200              /* receive ringbuffer overflow */
00101 #define UART_NO_DATA          0x0100              /* no receive data available   */
00102 
00103 
00104 /*
00105 ** function prototypes
00106 */
00107 
00108 
00109 /** Initialize the UART-Interfaces of Scooter controller Board
00110  * @return none
00111  * 
00112  * */
00113 void init_uart( void );
00114 
00115 /**
00116    @brief   Initialize UART and set baudrate 
00117    @param   baudrate Specify baudrate using macro UART_BAUD_SELECT()
00118    @return  none
00119 */
00120 extern void uart_init(unsigned int baudrate);
00121 
00122 
00123 /**
00124  *  @brief   Get received byte from ringbuffer
00125  *
00126  * Returns in the lower byte the received character and in the 
00127  * higher byte the last receive error.
00128  * UART_NO_DATA is returned when no data is available.
00129  *
00130  *  @param   void
00131  *  @return  lower byte:  received byte from ringbuffer
00132  *  @return  higher byte: last receive status
00133  *           - \b 0 successfully received data from UART
00134  *           - \b UART_NO_DATA           
00135  *             <br>no receive data available
00136  *           - \b UART_BUFFER_OVERFLOW   
00137  *             <br>Receive ringbuffer overflow.
00138  *             We are not reading the receive buffer fast enough, 
00139  *             one or more received character have been dropped 
00140  *           - \b UART_OVERRUN_ERROR     
00141  *             <br>Overrun condition by UART.
00142  *             A character already present in the UART UDR register was 
00143  *             not read by the interrupt handler before the next character arrived,
00144  *             one or more received characters have been dropped.
00145  *           - \b UART_FRAME_ERROR       
00146  *             <br>Framing Error by UART
00147  */
00148 extern unsigned int uart_getc(void);
00149 
00150 
00151 /**
00152  *  @brief   Put byte to ringbuffer for transmitting via UART
00153  *  @param   data byte to be transmitted
00154  *  @return  none
00155  */
00156 extern void uart_putc(unsigned char data);
00157 
00158 
00159 /**
00160  *  @brief   Put string to ringbuffer for transmitting via UART
00161  *
00162  *  The string is buffered by the uart library in a circular buffer
00163  *  and one character at a time is transmitted to the UART using interrupts.
00164  *  Blocks if it can not write the whole string into the circular buffer.
00165  * 
00166  *  @param   s string to be transmitted
00167  *  @return  none
00168  */
00169 extern void uart_puts(const char *s );
00170 
00171 
00172 /**
00173  * @brief    Put string from program memory to ringbuffer for transmitting via UART.
00174  *
00175  * The string is buffered by the uart library in a circular buffer
00176  * and one character at a time is transmitted to the UART using interrupts.
00177  * Blocks if it can not write the whole string into the circular buffer.
00178  *
00179  * @param    s program memory string to be transmitted
00180  * @return   none
00181  * @see      uart_puts_P
00182  */
00183 extern void uart_puts_p(const char *s );
00184 
00185 /**
00186  * @brief    Macro to automatically put a string constant into program memory
00187  */
00188 #define uart_puts_P(__s)       uart_puts_p(PSTR(__s))
00189 
00190 
00191 
00192 /** @brief  Initialize USART1 (only available on selected ATmegas) @see uart_init */
00193 extern void uart1_init(unsigned int baudrate);
00194 /** @brief  Get received byte of USART1 from ringbuffer. (only available on selected ATmega) @see uart_getc */
00195 extern unsigned int uart1_getc(void);
00196 /** @brief  Put byte to ringbuffer for transmitting via USART1 (only available on selected ATmega) @see uart_putc */
00197 extern void uart1_putc(unsigned char data);
00198 /** @brief  Put string to ringbuffer for transmitting via USART1 (only available on selected ATmega) @see uart_puts */
00199 extern void uart1_puts(const char *s );
00200 /** @brief  Put string from program memory to ringbuffer for transmitting via USART1 (only available on selected ATmega) @see uart_puts_p */
00201 extern void uart1_puts_p(const char *s );
00202 /** @brief  Macro to automatically put a string constant into program memory */
00203 #define uart1_puts_P(__s)       uart1_puts_p(PSTR(__s))
00204 
00205 /**@}*/
00206 
00207 
00208 
00209 #endif /*UART_H_*/
